page.title: 11NEWTON HALL WILDLIFE (4)
page.content: The urban development with its gardens of shrub,flower and vegetable has attracted a variety of garden birds eg-House and Tree Sparrow,Starling, Blackbird,Greenfinch,Linnet,Bullfinch, Chaffinch,Robin,Blue Tit,Great Tit, Magpie,Jackdaw,Woodpigeon,Rook and Collard Dove are evident.In the summer Swallow,Swift and House Martin fly overhead.On certain parts of the estate Fly Catchers,Tree Creepers, Willow Warblers and White Throat can be seen.In Winter migrants come into the gardens for food eg-Redwing, Blackcaps and Siskins.There is no doubt that Newton Hall has its own natural character.
